1/* $NetBSD: netaddr.h,v 1.3 2019/01/09 16:55:15 christos Exp $ */

14
15#ifndef ISC_NETADDR_H
16#define ISC_NETADDR_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/netaddr.h */
19
20#include <stdbool.h>
21#include <inttypes.h>
22
23#include <isc/lang.h>
24#include <isc/net.h>
25#include <isc/types.h>
26
27#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
28#include <sys/types.h>
29#include <sys/un.h>
30#endif
31
32ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
33
34struct isc_netaddr {
35 unsigned int family;
36 union {
37 struct in_addr in;
38 struct in6_addr in6;
39#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
40 char un[sizeof(((struct sockaddr_un *)0)->sun_path)];
41#endif
42 } type;
43 uint32_t zone;
44};
45
46bool
47isc_netaddr_equal(const isc_netaddr_t *a, const isc_netaddr_t *b);
48
49/*%<
50 * Compare network addresses 'a' and 'b'. Return #true if
51 * they are equal, #false if not.
52 */
53
54bool
55isc_netaddr_eqprefix(const isc_netaddr_t *a, const isc_netaddr_t *b,
56 unsigned int prefixlen);
57/*%<
58 * Compare the 'prefixlen' most significant bits of the network
59 * addresses 'a' and 'b'. If 'b''s scope is zero then 'a''s scope is
60 * ignored. Return #true if they are equal, #false if not.
61 */
62
63isc_result_t
64isc_netaddr_masktoprefixlen(const isc_netaddr_t *s, unsigned int *lenp);
65/*%<
66 * Convert a netmask in 's' into a prefix length in '*lenp'.
67 * The mask should consist of zero or more '1' bits in the
68 * most significant part of the address, followed by '0' bits.
69 * If this is not the case, #ISC_R_MASKNONCONTIG is returned.
70 *
71 * Returns:
72 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
73 *\li #ISC_R_MASKNONCONTIG
74 */
75
76isc_result_t
77isc_netaddr_totext(const isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, isc_buffer_t *target);
78/*%<
79 * Append a text representation of 'sockaddr' to the buffer 'target'.
80 * The text is NOT null terminated. Handles IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
81 *
82 * Returns:
83 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
84 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE The text or the null termination did not fit.
85 *\li #ISC_R_FAILURE Unspecified failure
86 */
87
88void
89isc_netaddr_format(const isc_netaddr_t *na, char *array, unsigned int size);
90/*%<
91 * Format a human-readable representation of the network address '*na'
92 * into the character array 'array', which is of size 'size'.
93 * The resulting string is guaranteed to be null-terminated.
94 */
95
96#define ISC_NETADDR_FORMATSIZE \
97 sizeof("xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX%SSSSSSSSSS")
98/*%<
99 * Minimum size of array to pass to isc_netaddr_format().
100 */
101
102void
103isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, const isc_sockaddr_t *source);
104
105void
106isc_netaddr_fromin(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, const struct in_addr *ina);
107
108void
109isc_netaddr_fromin6(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, const struct in6_addr *ina6);
110
111isc_result_t
112isc_netaddr_frompath(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, const char *path);
113
114void
115isc_netaddr_setzone(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr, uint32_t zone);
116
117uint32_t
118isc_netaddr_getzone(const isc_netaddr_t *netaddr);
119
120void
121isc_netaddr_any(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr);
122/*%<
123 * Return the IPv4 wildcard address.
124 */
125
126void
127isc_netaddr_any6(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr);
128/*%<
129 * Return the IPv6 wildcard address.
130 */
131
132void
133isc_netaddr_unspec(isc_netaddr_t *netaddr);
134/*%<
135 * Initialize as AF_UNSPEC address.
136 */
137
138bool
139isc_netaddr_ismulticast(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
140/*%<
141 * Returns true if the address is a multicast address.
142 */
143
144bool
145isc_netaddr_isexperimental(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
146/*%<
147 * Returns true if the address is a experimental (CLASS E) address.
148 */
149
150bool
151isc_netaddr_islinklocal(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
152/*%<
153 * Returns #true if the address is a link local address.
154 */
155
156bool
157isc_netaddr_issitelocal(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
158/*%<
159 * Returns #true if the address is a site local address.
160 */
161
162bool
163isc_netaddr_isnetzero(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
164/*%<
165 * Returns #true if the address is in net zero.
166 */
167
168void
169isc_netaddr_fromv4mapped(isc_netaddr_t *t, const isc_netaddr_t *s);
170/*%<
171 * Convert an IPv6 v4mapped address into an IPv4 address.
172 */
173
174isc_result_t
175isc_netaddr_prefixok(const isc_netaddr_t *na, unsigned int prefixlen);
176/*
177 * Test whether the netaddr 'na' and 'prefixlen' are consistant.
178 * e.g. prefixlen within range.
179 * na does not have bits set which are not covered by the prefixlen.
180 *
181 * Returns:
182 * ISC_R_SUCCESS
183 * ISC_R_RANGE prefixlen out of range
184 * ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED unsupported family
185 * ISC_R_FAILURE extra bits.
186 */
187
188bool
189isc_netaddr_isloopback(const isc_netaddr_t *na);
190/*
191 * Test whether the netaddr 'na' is a loopback IPv4 or IPv6 address (in
192 * 127.0.0.0/8 or ::1).
193 */
194ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
195
196#endif /* ISC_NETADDR_H */
197
